summary: The concept of "metal coating" pertains to processes applied within the iron, steel, and other metal industries, specifically under EU regulatory frameworks. Metal coating involves the application of protective layers to metal surfaces to enhance durability, corrosion resistance, and aesthetic qualities. This practice is governed by various EU directives and regulations aimed at ensuring environmental protection and product safety, including compliance with REACH (Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals) and the Eco-Design Directive. Effective regulation of metal coating processes is essential for maintaining industry standards and promoting sustainable practices within the EU market.
